titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rose Cosgrove County Longford Ladies Auxiliary Papers AIA.061
titlestmt.author: Bonnie Gordon

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

change.item: Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2025 accretion

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Rose Cosgrove County Longford Ladies Auxiliary Papers

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box, 2 oversize flat boxes, 2 small artifact boxes, and 1 folder in shared housing

did.abstract: Rose Cosgrove (1908-2009) was a leading member of the County Longford Association and the County Longford Social Club of New York. This collection consists of materials pertaining to the County Longford Ladies Auxiliary, the County Longford Association, the United Irish Counties Association, and other Irish American organizations based in the greater New York City area. Materials include photographs, artwork, event programs, as well as various artifacts, such as banners, ribbons, buttons, and ceremonial uniforms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials pertaining to the County Longford Ladies Auxiliary, the County Longford Association, the United Irish Counties Association, and other Irish American organizations based in the greater New York City area. Materials include photographs, artwork, event programs, as well as various artifacts, such as banners, ribbons, buttons, and ceremonial uniforms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Archives of Irish America County Societies Collection (AIA 003)
United Irish Counties Association of New York (AIA 056)

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rose Cosgrove (1908-2009) was a leading member of the County Longford Association and the County Longford Social Club of New York. Born in Dernaferst, Lough Gowna, Co. Cavan, she emigrated to New York as a young woman. Upon her arrival, she worked as a housekeeper and joined numerous Irish American social organizations. She served as the president of the Co. Longford Association from 1982-1984. Up until the last ten years of her life, Cosgrove travelled to Ireland annually.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Brigid Connolly Sullivan, Rose Cosgrove's neice, donated the materials in this collection to Glucksman Ireland House in anticipation of an exhibit in 2010. Additional donations were received at an unknown, later date. The accession number associated with this gift is 2011.002.
In March 2025, Marion Casey donated an accretion of photographs; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2025.026.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Rose Cosgrove County Longford Ladies Auxiliary Papers; AIA 061; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding the arrangement, description, and physical interventions taken on this collection prior to 2025 are not documented. In March 2025, an accretion of photographs was rehoused in an archival box and folder, and intellectually added to the collection's alphabetical inventory.
